Title: Amazing Camera
Cons: Only that I do not fully understand all its uses yet
Pros: Where to begin? I love this camera. Great entry level camera for any photographer looking for a great DSLR. I did not buy mine here, but own the same camera. Came with 18-55 and 55-200 Nikkor lens. MF/AF are on both the lenses. Enjoy the manual modes on camera. Shutter speed up to 1/4000 of a second is good for shooting in extremely sunny conditions, and has a long exposure for those dark shots too.
Comments: I take a lot of surfing photography. The 200mm lenses is perfect from the beach. With the 10mp I can crop away, right to their face and the picture is still clear. I also have a picture on my wall. 30"x20". Clear as it was on my computer. I recommend buying high speed SDHC for anyone looking for sports photography. The quicker it goes to the card rather than stay on the cameras que the better.

Title: The lens is key
Cons: There is no auto-focus motor on the body, therefore the camera cannot auto-focus if you aren't using a lens with an integrated motor such as the Nikon AF-I or AF-S lens. This isn't really a problem since they're really nice lenses, and with Nikon's VR (vibration reduction) technology, there's really nothing to dislike about them. Just something to keep in mind if you plan to shop further.
Pros: The body is awesome. Really simple, intuitive interface. Usable for both beginner and expert. The sensor is really nice. Photos are crisp and the color is rich. The lens is excellent for a consumer grade lens. You really can't get a better bang for the buck. The body feels like it was meant to be held, you're not holding the camera as much as it is an extension of your hand. There's no contorting to get to commonly used controls.
Comments: I chose the d40x over the Canon EOS 400D (rebel XTI) because the lens that ships with the Nikon is much nicer. Initially the lack of lens variety was a detractor, however the research I did suggested that the d40x shipped with a better lens. This proved true. I've been so impressed with it that even if given the choice, I'd still buy and use Nikon's line of lenses.

Title: Great DSLR camera!
Cons: Could not afford to buy sooner!
Pros: This is great camera! Very compact, and picture quality is perfect!

Title: Nikon D40x
Cons: none yet.
Pros:
great feel.  great features onboard the camera.  Can go from novice point and click to total control pro.  This was a gift for my father who has been an amateur film camera photography for years.  He was a bit skeptical but after 3 days he was in love with it. Great entry point DSLR.

HCSD is extremely important on a camera > 6 MP.
Comments: almost too many features for a novice - you feel compelled to try everything, but it's the first step to learn more.

Title: The Right Camera
Cons: none
Pros: Camera is everything I hoped it would be
Comments: I researched Cameras for a few weeks before spending this much money. It was a toss-up between the Nikon and the Canon XTi. I think I got the right camera

Title: Excellent Camera
Cons: None noted
Pros: Very easy to use and great for those striving for something a better than a compact hand-held digital camera.

Title: Amazing Camera
Cons: Steep learning curve for all the features even if you shot 35mm film with a good camera.
Pros: Crystal Clear pictures. Enough flexibility for almost everyone. From the first picture you will wonder how you lived without it.
Comments: Invest in the SB-600 flash.  It's the best upgrade you can get for the money.  Take tome to really learn the camera. Nikon Digitutor site is a big help.

Title: Satisfied as Usual
Cons: It didn't come with a Telophoto Lens at this price.
Pros: This is by far the best camera I have ever owned, it was preeceded by two SLR film cameras from Pentax over a 30 year period.  I have lots to learn.

Title: great digital slr camera
Cons: none so far
Pros: shots fast, great resolution, works with my existing nikon lens i had from my nikon em 35mm film camera. as usual newegg's hipping and packaging is tops. i'd recommend this camera for any one looking for a really nice entry level digital slr  or for those like me who use the 35mm slr camera and wanted to go digital and needed one that can also use thier existing lenses as  any lens can be pricey
Comments: just a tip. when using normal 35mm lenses with this make sure you have the camera and flash in manual mode. the instructions book isn't exactly clear on this

Title: Excellent camera
Cons: None!
Pros: Light yet robust construction, a superb kit overall.  Auto modes are quite adequate, even on horrible light conditions.
Comments: The D40X would suit fine an amateur photographer, or a professional looking for a light backup camera.
